chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas Alan Johnston-Burnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CF283 and concurrent to current prison sentence 12CF48 Vilas County

superMiscConds.notes: Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.  A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered.

10:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas Alan Johnston-Burnett in court, in custody. Cases called appearanes given.  Victim rights complied with in 22CF7 Victim is not present.  Deft enters a plea of guilty to the charge Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty. 

Court orders
18 mo initial confinement   12 mo extended supervision concurrent to 21CF283 and concurrent to current prison sentence 12CF48 Vilas County
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.  A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered. 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & Substance Abuse programs 
DNA sample unless already done.

1:58 PM - case called.  Defendant Lucas Alan Johnston-Burnett not in court.  Attorney Kurt B. Zengler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear - in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Court questions Atty Zengler regarding service.  Response by Atty Zengler - Defendant has served.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by the Court.
